meanings.sent1: In math class, we learned how to interpret nomographs to understand relationships between numbers.
meanings.sent2: Scientists often use nomographs to visually display complex mathematical concepts.
meanings.sent3: The nomographs at the science fair were so colorful and interesting that they looked like art pieces.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like a nomograph, effortlessly connecting different mathematical ideas.
meanings.sent5: The teacher drew a large nomograph on the board to explain the correlation between variables.

meanings.definition: A chart or diagram used to solve equations
meanings.sent1: When I got stuck on the math problem, I found the solution by studying the nomographs in my textbook.
meanings.sent2: The nomographs in the engineering manual helped the students understand how to solve complex equations.
meanings.sent3: The nomographs in the puzzle book were so tricky that they made my head spin.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to read nomographs was like having a secret code to unlock any equation.
meanings.sent5: The nomograph on the wall showed the step-by-step process to solve the equation.

meanings.definition: A visual representation of data using lines or curves
meanings.sent1: The nomographs in the presentation made it easier for everyone to grasp the data trends.
meanings.sent2: Graphic designers often use nomographs to create visually appealing representations of statistical information.
meanings.sent3: The nomographs on the weather report looked like colorful roller coasters of temperature changes.
meanings.sent4: Her artistic nomographs transformed boring data into captivating visual stories.
meanings.sent5: The nomograph beautifully illustrated the correlation between time and sales figures.
